original: phan yon ni /
analyzed: phan yon ni /
translated: The benefits are

analyzed: tshul khrims kyi phan yon rnam pa bcu ste /

original: 'gyod pa med pa'i rim gyis mchog tu dga' ba sngon du 'gro ba'i chos thob par 'gyur pa dang / 'gyod pa med par 'chi ba'i dus byed par 'gyur ba dang / phyogs bcur snyan pa'i sgra grags par 'gyur ba dang / bde bar gnyid kyis log cing bde bar sad par 'gyur pa dang /

translated: When they fall asleep, the gods will protect them. They will not be afraid of being threatened by others, nor will they be powerless. Even if enemies find an opportunity,

original: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i dbang gis de dag bsrungs pa la sogs pas phan 'dogs par 'gyur ba dang / gnod sbyin dang / mi ma yin pa dang / gdug pa gnyug mar gnas pa rnams kyis glags shig rnyed na yang /

translated: through the power of pure discipline, they will be protected and so forth. Even if local spirits, non-humans, and evil beings find an opportunity,

original: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i dbang gis de dag bsrung ba la sogs pas phan 'dogs par 'gyur ba dang / gzhan las chos gos la sogs pa dag chos kyis tshegs chung dus thob par 'gyur ba dang / gang du skye bar 'dod pa la sogs pa smon lam thams cad yang dag par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i dbang gis de dag bsrung ba la sogs pas phan 'dogs par 'gyur ba dang / gzhan las chos gos la sogs pa dag chos kyis tshegs chung dus thob par 'gyur ba dang / gang du skye bar 'dod pa la sogs pa smon lam thams cad yang dag par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: By the power of pure morality, they will be protected and so forth. They will obtain robes and so forth from others with little difficulty. All their aspirations, such as being born in a certain place, will be fulfilled.

original: dbang po sngom pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po sngom pa gang zhe na /

analyzed: tshul khrims kyi sdom pa de nyid la brten nas /
translated: It is the protection of mindfulness by means of that very restraint of morality.

original: dran pa kun du bsrung ba dang / dran pa la rtag 'grus byed pa dang / dran pas yid kun du bsrung ba dang / gnas skabs mnyam pa la 'jog par byed cing /
analyzed: dran pa kun du bsrung ba dang / dran pa la rtag 'grus byed pa dang / dran pas yid kun du bsrung ba dang / gnas skabs mnyam pa la 'jog par byed cing /
translated: It is the constant practice of mindfulness, the protection of the mind by means of mindfulness, the establishment of the mind in its natural state,

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyis gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams rnam par shes pa na yang mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing /
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyis gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams rnam par shes pa na yang mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing /
translated: and the non-grasping of signs when the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body and mind are conscious of forms, sounds, smells, tastes, touches and mental objects.

original: mngon rtags su mi 'dzin la /
analyzed: mngon rtags su mi 'dzin la /
translated: He does not take on the signs of these.üîΩHe practices in order to guard the faculties,

original: gzhi gang kho na las de'i sems kyi rjes su sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams zag par 'gyur pa'i phyir sgrub par byed cing /
analyzed: gzhi gang kho na las de'i sems kyi rjes su sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams zag par 'gyur pa'i phyir sgrub par byed cing /
translated: because he is able to prevent the arising of nonvirtuous phenomena that are in opposition to his mind.

original: dbang po rnams kyang srung bar byed la /üîΩdbang po rnams kyis kyang sdom pa sgrub par byed pas /
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyang srung bar byed la / dbang po rnams kyis kyang sdom pa sgrub par byed pas /
translated: He practices restraint with his faculties

original: @12a * // dbang po rnams kyi sgo bsdams pa yin no //
analyzed: @12a * // dbang po rnams kyi sgo bsdams pa yin no //
translated: because he is able to prevent the arising of nonvirtuous phenomena that are in opposition to his mind.

original: zas kyi tshod rig pa nyid gang zhe na /üîΩde ltar dbang po bsdams pa de so sor brtags shing zas za bar byed pa rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ma yin /üîΩrgyags pa'i phyir ma yin /üîΩsgeg pa'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: zas kyi tshod rig pa nyid gang zhe na / de ltar dbang po bsdams pa de so sor brtags shing zas za bar byed pa rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ma yin / rgyags pa'i phyir ma yin / sgeg pa'i phyir ma yin /
translated: What is moderation in eating?üîΩHe eats in moderation, not for fun,üîΩnot for vanity,üîΩnot for beautification,

original: brgyan pa'i phyir ma yin gyi /
analyzed: brgyan pa'i phyir ma yin gyi /
translated: not for adornment,

original: lus 'di gnas par bya ba dang / 'tsho bar bya ba dang / bkres pa bsal bar bya ba dang / tshangs par spyod pa la phan par bya ba dang / tshor ba rnying rnams spang bar bya ba dang / gsar rnams mi skye bar bya ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: lus 'di gnas par bya ba dang / 'tsho bar bya ba dang / bkres pa bsal bar bya ba dang / tshangs par spyod pa la phan par bya ba dang / tshor ba rnying rnams spang bar bya ba dang / gsar rnams mi skye bar bya ba'i phyir dang /
translated: I will maintain this body, I will nourish it, I will remove its pain, I will assist the practice of celibacy, I will remove old feelings and not produce new ones.

original: bdag 'tsho zhing stobs dang bde ba dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / bde ba la reg par gnas par yang 'gyur ro snyam du sems shing zas za ba yin no //
analyzed: bdag 'tsho zhing stobs dang bde ba dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / bde ba la reg par gnas par yang 'gyur ro snyam du sems shing zas za ba yin no //
translated: I will live, I will be strong, I will be happy, I will be without sin, and I will be in touch with bliss.‚Äô

original: nam gyi cha stod dang nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: nam gyi cha stod dang nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is the practice of not lying down in the first or last part of the night?

original: de ltar zas kyi tshod rig pa de nyin mo 'chag pa dang / 'dug pa dag gis sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las sems yongs su sbyong bar byed cing /
analyzed: de ltar zas kyi tshod rig pa de nyin mo 'chag pa dang / 'dug pa dag gis sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las sems yongs su sbyong bar byed cing /
translated: ‚ÄúThe one who knows the right amount of food, during the day, through walking and sitting, purifies his mind from obstacles.

original: mtshan mo'i thun dang po la yang 'chag pa dang / 'dug pa dag gis sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las sems yongs su sbyong bar byed la /
analyzed: mtshan mo'i thun dang po la yang 'chag pa dang / 'dug pa dag gis sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las sems yongs su sbyong bar byed la /
translated: In the first part of the night, he should purify his mind from obscurations by walking and sitting.

original: mtshan mo'i gung thun la gtsug lag khang nas phyir byung ste /
analyzed: mtshan mo'i gung thun la gtsug lag khang nas phyir byung ste /
translated: In the middle part of the night, he should lie down in a secluded place outside the monastery.

original: gtsug lag khang gi phyi rol du rkang pa bkrus nas /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi phyi rol du rkang pa bkrus nas /
translated: Having gone outside the monastery, he should wash his feet.

original: gtsug lag khang gi nang du zhugs te /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi nang du zhugs te /
translated: Having entered the monastery,

original: glo g-yas pa phab nas rkang pa'i steng du rkang pa bzhag ste /üîΩsnang ba'i 'du shes dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang ldan pa kho na'i 'du shes yid la byed bzhin du nyal bar byed pa dang / mtshan mo'i thun tha ma la myur ba myur ba kho nar sad par byas nas 'chag pa dang /
analyzed: glo g-yas pa phab nas rkang pa'i steng du rkang pa bzhag ste / snang ba'i 'du shes dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang ldan pa kho na'i 'du shes yid la byed bzhin du nyal bar byed pa dang / mtshan mo'i thun tha ma la myur ba myur ba kho nar sad par byas nas 'chag pa dang /
translated: he should lie down on his right side, placing one foot on top of the other,üîΩwith his mind alert, with mindfulness well-established, and with his thoughts focused on rising.

original: 'dug pa dag gis sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las sems yongs su sbyong bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dug pa dag gis sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las sems yongs su sbyong bar byed pa yin no //
translated: In the last part of the night, he should quickly rise and purify his mind from obscurations by walking and sitting.

original: shes bzhin du spyod pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: shes bzhin du spyod pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the practice of being watchful?

original: de ltar mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson par gyur pa de 'gro ba dang / ldog pa la shes bzhin du sbyor bar byed pa dang / cung zad bltas pa dang / rnam par bltas pa dang / bskum pa dang / brkyang ba dang /
analyzed: de ltar mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson par gyur pa de 'gro ba dang / ldog pa la shes bzhin du sbyor bar byed pa dang / cung zad bltas pa dang / rnam par bltas pa dang / bskum pa dang / brkyang ba dang /
translated: Thus, after applying oneself to not lying down, one should apply oneself to going and returning with full awareness, and to looking straight ahead, looking all around, contracting, extending,

original: snam sbyar dang / chos gos dang / lhung bzed bcang ba dang / zos pa dang / 'thungs pa @12b dang ; 'chos pa dang / myangs pa dang / song ba dang / sdod pa dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dang / mi nyal ba dang /
analyzed: snam sbyar dang / chos gos dang / lhung bzed bcang ba dang / zos pa dang / 'thungs pa @12b dang ; 'chos pa dang / myangs pa dang / song ba dang / sdod pa dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dang / mi nyal ba dang /
translated: carrying the upper robe, Dharma robe, and alms-bowl, eating, drinking, chewing, tasting, going, standing, sitting, lying down, not lying down,

original: smra ba dang / mi smra ba dang / gnyid kyis snyom ba bsang ba la yang /
analyzed: smra ba dang / mi smra ba dang / gnyid kyis snyom ba bsang ba la yang /
translated: speaking, not speaking, and clearing away sleepiness and drowsiness.

original: shes bzhin du spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: shes bzhin du spyod pa yin no //
translated: One should practice with full awareness.

original: des ni tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang rab tu dkon na /
analyzed: des ni tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang rab tu dkon na /
translated: If one who is thus diligent in applying oneself to not lying down has already attained the restraint of morality,

original: dbang po sdom pa la sogs pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bstan to //
analyzed: dbang po sdom pa la sogs pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bstan to //
translated: what need is there to mention the restraint of the faculties and so on?

original: tshul khrims yongs su dag gyur kyang //
analyzed: tshul khrims yongs su dag gyur kyang //
translated: Even though one's morality is completely pure,

original: grogs bzang shin tu rnyed par dka' //üîΩzhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: grogs bzang shin tu rnyed par dka' // zhes bya bas ni /
translated: A good friend is very difficult to find.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang / dam pa'i chos nyan cing sems pa dang / bar chad med pa dang / gtong ba spel ba dang dge sbyong gi rgyan dkon par bstan to //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang / dam pa'i chos nyan cing sems pa dang / bar chad med pa dang / gtong ba spel ba dang dge sbyong gi rgyan dkon par bstan to //
translated: This shows the rarity of a spiritual teacher, of listening to and reflecting on the holy Dharma, of freedom from obstacles, of increasing generosity, and of the ornaments of a spiritual practitioner.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gang zhe na /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gang zhe na /
translated: What is a spiritual teacher?

original: rgyu rnam pa brgyad kyis na rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu rnam pa brgyad kyis na rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: He should be known as a spiritual teacher who is complete in every way if he is endowed with eight qualities.

original: brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight?

original: tshul khrims la gnas pa dang / mang du thos pa dang / rtogs pa dang ldan pa dang / rjes su snying brtse ba dang ldan pa dang / yid yongs su mi skyo ba dang / bzod pa dang ldan pa dang / mi 'jigs pa dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims la gnas pa dang / mang du thos pa dang / rtogs pa dang ldan pa dang / rjes su snying brtse ba dang ldan pa dang / yid yongs su mi skyo ba dang / bzod pa dang ldan pa dang / mi 'jigs pa dang ldan pa dang /
translated: He is one who keeps moral discipline, is learned, has realization, is compassionate, is tireless, is patient, is fearless,

original: tshig gi bya ba dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig gi bya ba dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: and is eloquent.

original: dam pa'i chos nyan cing sems pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos nyan cing sems pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is listening to and reflecting on the holy Dharma?

original: dam pa sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams kyis bstan pa'i chos gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis sde snod gsum gyis bsdus pa dag 'dzin cing /
analyzed: dam pa sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams kyis bstan pa'i chos gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis sde snod gsum gyis bsdus pa dag 'dzin cing /
translated: They retain the Dharma taught by the Buddha and the Buddha's disciples, which is included in the scriptures, the twelve branches of the scriptures, and the three collections.

original: tshig 'bru dang don nyan pa gcig pu dben par song ste /
analyzed: tshig 'bru dang don nyan pa gcig pu dben par song ste /
translated: They listen to the words and meanings, go to a solitary place,

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas rnams spangs pas ji skad thos pa'i chos de dag nyid rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas bgrang ba'i rnam pas chos rnams la 'grang ba'i tshul gyis sems par byed pa dang / gzhal ba'i rnam pa'i rigs pas yon tan dang skyon nye bar brtag pa'i tshul gyis sems par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas rnams spangs pas ji skad thos pa'i chos de dag nyid rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas bgrang ba'i rnam pas chos rnams la 'grang ba'i tshul gyis sems par byed pa dang / gzhal ba'i rnam pa'i rigs pas yon tan dang skyon nye bar brtag pa'i tshul gyis sems par byed pa yin no //
translated: and reflect on those very teachings that they have heard by way of enumeration of the phenomena by way of their general and specific characteristics, and they reflect by way of the reasoning of the mode of investigation that closely examines their good qualities and faults by way of the mode of investigation of evaluation.

original: bar chad med pa gang zhe na /üîΩnang la brten pa'i bar chad dang / phyi rol la brten pa'i bar chad med pa ste /
analyzed: bar chad med pa gang zhe na / nang la brten pa'i bar chad dang / phyi rol la brten pa'i bar chad med pa ste /
translated: What is uninterrupted?üîΩIt is the absence of internal and external obstacles.

original: de la nang la brten pa'i bar chad ni /
analyzed: de la nang la brten pa'i bar chad ni /
translated: The internal obstacles are

original: sngon bsod nams ma byas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sngon bsod nams ma byas pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of not having previously created merit,

original: 'tsho ba'i yo byad rkyen du bab pa dag dus dus su rnyed par mi 'gyur dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug shas che zhing yun @13a * //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i yo byad rkyen du bab pa dag dus dus su rnyed par mi 'gyur dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug shas che zhing yun @13a * //
translated: one will not obtain the requisites for living from time to time, and one will have a great deal of desire, hatred, and confusion for a long time.üîΩBecause of having previously created karma for much illness, one will have much illness.

original: ring ba dang / sngon nad mang bar 'gyur ba'i las byas pas nad mang ba dang / tshe 'di la mi mthun par spyad pas /
analyzed: ring ba dang / sngon nad mang bar 'gyur ba'i las byas pas nad mang ba dang / tshe 'di la mi mthun par spyad pas /
translated: Because of having practiced unpleasantly in this life,üîΩone‚Äôs body will have wind, bile, and phlegm disorders, and one will have indigestion and so forth.

original: de'i lus la rlung dang mkhris pa dang / bad kan 'khrug cing gsud pa la sogs par 'gyur ba dang / zas lag du ba dang / don mang ba dang / bya ba mang ba dang / tshogs 'du ba mang ba dang / las la dga' ba dang /
analyzed: de'i lus la rlung dang mkhris pa dang / bad kan 'khrug cing gsud pa la sogs par 'gyur ba dang / zas lag du ba dang / don mang ba dang / bya ba mang ba dang / tshogs 'du ba mang ba dang / las la dga' ba dang /
translated: One will have much food, much business, much work, many assemblies, and much activity.

original: smra ba la dga' ba dang / gnyid la dga' ba dang / bre mo'i gtam la dga' ba dang / 'du 'dzin la dga' ba dang / bdag nyid rab tu 'dzin pa dang / mi brtan pa dang / bag med pa dang / yul ngan par skyes pa dang /
analyzed: smra ba la dga' ba dang / gnyid la dga' ba dang / bre mo'i gtam la dga' ba dang / 'du 'dzin la dga' ba dang / bdag nyid rab tu 'dzin pa dang / mi brtan pa dang / bag med pa dang / yul ngan par skyes pa dang /
translated: One will delight in work, in talking, in sleeping, in idle gossip, in busyness, in self-importance, in instability, in carelessness, and in being born in a bad place.

original: de lta bu dag dang mthun pa dag go //
analyzed: de lta bu dag dang mthun pa dag go //
translated: Such are the unfavorable conditions.

original: phyi rol la brten pa'i bar chad ni /
analyzed: phyi rol la brten pa'i bar chad ni /
translated: The unfavorable conditions that are external are:

original: skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa la brten cing de la rjes su mthun pa'i gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa dus su mi 'thob pa dang / yul ngan par gnas pas nyin mo mi sdug pa mang ba dang ; mtshan mo skye bo mang po rtag tu sgra 'byin cing /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa la brten cing de la rjes su mthun pa'i gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa dus su mi 'thob pa dang / yul ngan par gnas pas nyin mo mi sdug pa mang ba dang ; mtshan mo skye bo mang po rtag tu sgra 'byin cing /
translated: not to have a spiritual teacher, not to receive timely instructions and teachings from him, to live in a bad country, where there are many unpleasant things by day and much noise and confusion at night,

original: ca co mang la klag cor che ba dang / rlung dang nyi ma'i reg pa grang zhing tsha ba dang / mi dang mi ma yin pas 'jigs pa dang / de lta bu dag dang mthun pa dag go //
analyzed: ca co mang la klag cor che ba dang / rlung dang nyi ma'i reg pa grang zhing tsha ba dang / mi dang mi ma yin pas 'jigs pa dang / de lta bu dag dang mthun pa dag go //
translated: where there are many people who are inconsiderate, who talk too much, who are restless and noisy, where the climate is bad, with cold and hot winds, and where there are many non-human beings, and where there are many human beings who are untamed and uncivilized.

original: gzhan yang bar chad rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang bar chad rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are also three other unfavorable conditions:

original: sbyor ba'i bar chad dang / rab tu dben pa'i bar chad dang / nang du yang dag 'jog gi bar chad dag med pa ni bar chad med pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i bar chad dang / rab tu dben pa'i bar chad dang / nang du yang dag 'jog gi bar chad dag med pa ni bar chad med pa yin no //
translated: the unfavorable condition of application, the unfavorable condition of solitude, and the unfavorable condition of concentration.

original: gtong ba spel ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: gtong ba spel ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the development of giving?

original: sems kyi rgyan dang / sems kyi yo byad dang / rnal 'byor gyi tshogs dang / don gyi mchog thob par bya ba'i kha na ma tho ba med pa'i sbyin par byed pa ste /üîΩde yang sus sbyin par byed /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyan dang / sems kyi yo byad dang / rnal 'byor gyi tshogs dang / don gyi mchog thob par bya ba'i kha na ma tho ba med pa'i sbyin par byed pa ste / de yang sus sbyin par byed /
translated: It is a gift that is a mental adornment, a mental equipment, a collection of yogas, and a gift that is irreproachable for attaining the highest goal.üîΩBy whom is it given?

original: su la sbyin par byed /üîΩci zhig sbyin par byed /
analyzed: su la sbyin par byed / ci zhig sbyin par byed /
translated: To whom is it given?üîΩWhat is given?

original: cis sbyin par byed /
analyzed: cis sbyin par byed /
translated: By what means is it given?

original: ji ltar sbyin par byed /
analyzed: ji ltar sbyin par byed /
translated: How is it given?

original: ci'i phyir sbyin par byed cing /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sbyin par byed cing /
translated: For what purpose is it given?

original: gang gis de'i sbyin pa kha na ma tho ba med par 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis de'i sbyin pa kha na ma tho ba med par 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
translated: By what means is the gift of the bodhisattva irreproachable?

original: sbyin pa po dang sbyin bdag gis sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: sbyin pa po dang sbyin bdag gis sbyin par byed do //
translated: It is given by the giver and the benefactor.

original: su la sbyin par byed ce na /
analyzed: su la sbyin par byed ce na /
translated: To whom is it given?

original: bzhi la ste /
analyzed: bzhi la ste /
translated: It is given to four kinds of persons:

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / phan 'dogs pa dang / sdug pa dang / khyad par can la sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang / phan 'dogs pa dang / sdug pa dang / khyad par can la sbyin par byed do //
translated: those who are suffering, those who are helpful, those who are loved, and those who are outstanding.

original: ci zhig sbyin par byed ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig sbyin par byed ce na /
translated: What is given?

original: sems can du bgrang ba dang / sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa'i dngos po sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: sems can du bgrang ba dang / sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa'i dngos po sbyin par byed do //
translated: It is given as an entity that is counted as a sentient being or as an entity that is not counted as a sentient being.

original: cis sbyin @13b par byed ce na /üîΩsems mngon par 'du byed pa yid kyi las chags pa med pa dang ldan pa'i sems pa gang yin pa dang / sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po yongs su gtong bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: cis sbyin @13b par byed ce na / sems mngon par 'du byed pa yid kyi las chags pa med pa dang ldan pa'i sems pa gang yin pa dang / sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po yongs su gtong bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: What is the means by which one gives?

original: rang gi rgyud dang gzhan gyi rgyud la de kun nas bslang ba'i lus dang / ngag gi las gang yin pa des sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud dang gzhan gyi rgyud la de kun nas bslang ba'i lus dang / ngag gi las gang yin pa des sbyin par byed do //
translated: It is the mental karma of volition, which is the mental factor of intention associated with nonattachment, and the physical and verbal karmas that are motivated by it, in order to give away the things that are to be given.

original: ji ltar sbyin par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar sbyin par byed ce na /
translated: How does one give?

original: ma 'ongs pa la lta ba dang / 'bras bu mthong ba'i dang dad pas sbyin par byed pa dang dad pa'i sems kyis gus par sbyin par byed pa dang / brnyas pa med par rang gi lag nas sbyin par byed pa dang / gzhan la mkho ba'i dus su sbyin par byed pa dang /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa la lta ba dang / 'bras bu mthong ba'i dang dad pas sbyin par byed pa dang dad pa'i sems kyis gus par sbyin par byed pa dang / brnyas pa med par rang gi lag nas sbyin par byed pa dang / gzhan la mkho ba'i dus su sbyin par byed pa dang /
translated: One gives with a view to the future, with faith in the result, with a faithful and respectful attitude, without contempt, with one's own hands, at the appropriate time,

original: chos dang mthun pa dang gzu lums ma yin pas legs par bsgrubs te /
analyzed: chos dang mthun pa dang gzu lums ma yin pas legs par bsgrubs te /
